dk.statsbiblioteket.util.reader
Class CircularCharBuffer

java.lang.Object
  dk.statsbiblioteket.util.reader.CircularCharBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.CharSequence, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Character>
@QAInfo(level=NORMAL,
        state=IN_DEVELOPMENT,
        author="te, mke",
        comment="Lots of room for performance-improvements (basically for all iterative usages as arrayCopy is much more efficient). The Reader-compatible and Query-compatible methods are largely untested")
public class CircularCharBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.CharSequence, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Character>

A memory efficient Queue/Reader-like mechanism for buffering character data. It avoids memory reallocations by traversing its internal character buffer in a circular manner, hence the name of the class.

The buffer is not thread-safe. It is method-compatible with Reader.

Note: the Queue-calls involved conversion between char and Character and are thus not the fastest.

Constructor Detail

CircularCharBuffer

public CircularCharBuffer(int initialSize,
                          int maxSize)
Create a new buffer with an initial capacity of initialSize characters and a maximum allowed size of maxSize characters.

The buffer will automatically grow beyond initialSize as data is added, but will raise an error if the allocation would go above maxSize.

Parameters:
initialSize - number of characters for the initial allocation
maxSize - maximum number of characters that can be stored in this buffer

public void put(char c)
Put the char in the buffer, expanding it if necessary.

Parameters:
c - the character to add to the buffer.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the buffer needs to be expanded, but has reached the maximum size.

Throws:

public int read(char[] cbuf,
                int off,
                int len)
An equivalent to Reader.read(char[], int, int). Moves buffered chars to cbuf.

Parameters:

len - the maximum number of chars to move.
Returns:
the number of moved chars or -1 if no chars were buffered.

peek

public char peek(int ahead)
Get the character ahead steps from the current position in the buffer. Calling this method will affect the state of the buffer.

Parameters:
ahead - the number of characters to peek ahead.
Returns:
the character at the offset ahead.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if ahead is past the buffer end. That is, calling this method on an empty buffer will always throw this exception

public void clear()
Clears the content of the buffer. This does not de-allocate any memory.

subSequence

public CircularCharBuffer subSequence(int start,
                                      int end)
Get a circular char buffer reflecting a subsequence of this one. The returned buffer will start with the character at start and end with the character at end - 1.

The new buffer will have its maximum size equalling the maximum size of the buffer from which it was created.

Calling this method will not affect the state of the buffer.

Specified by:
subSequence in interface java.lang.CharSequence
Parameters:
start - the start offset into this buffer, inclusive
end - the end index into this buffer, exclusive
Returns:
a newly allocated circular char buffer
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start is negative
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if end is past the buffer length
